Article Title: 3-hr takedown, AI labels: Govt cracks down on deepfakes
Article Text:
AI-made, edited posts must carry clear disclosure

NEW DELHI: Cracking down on deepfakes, the Centre has tightened India's digital rules by mandating compulsory labelling, traceability and user declarations for AI-generated content. It has also sharply cut timelines to take down unlawful content to as little as three hours from 36 hours and placed direct compliance responsibility on social media platforms and their senior officers.For the first time, AI-generated material, including deepfake videos, synthetic audio and manipulated visuals, has been brought under a formal regulatory framework through amendments to the IT intermediary rules. The Information Technology (Intermediary Guidelines and Digital Media Ethics Code) Amendment Rules, 2026 will come into force from Feb 20.The amended rules introduce a statutory definition of "synthetically generated information" (SGI).The new rules impose mandatory obligations on intermediaries to identify, label and trace AI content. All AI-generated or AI-altered material must carry a clear and prominent disclosure visible to users.Platforms must also embed persistent metadata and unique identifiers to enable traceability of the content’s origin and the tools used to create it. Once applied, these disclosures cannot be altered, hidden or removed.The rules exclude routine edits such as colour correction, noise reduction, compression or translation, as long as they do not change the meaning. Clearly hypothetical or illustrative drafts are exempt.Large social media platforms face stricter compliance requirements. Before any content goes live, platforms must ensure users declare if it is AI-generated. Intermediaries must deploy automated tools to verify these declarations by analysing the content’s format, source and characteristics. If content is identified as synthetic, visible labelling becomes mandatory. Platforms that knowingly allow unlabelled AI-generated content to remain online will be treated as having failed their due-diligence obligations.The rules also compress response timelines. Certain lawful takedown orders must now be complied with within three hours, compared to 36 hours earlier. Other deadlines have been tightened, with a 15-day window reduced to 7 days and a 24-hour window cut to 12 hours. Platforms must acknowledge user grievances within two hours and resolve them within seven days.Oversight and enforcement will rest with the ministry of electronics and information technology, while users can appeal platform decisions to the grievance appellate committee.Misuse of SGI linked to child sexual abuse material, obscene content, false electronic records, impersonation using a real person’s identity or voice, or explosives-related material will attract action under multiple criminal laws.Platforms must also warn users at least once every three months about penalties for misuse of AI-generated content.
Article Summary: The centre has tightened india's digital rules by mandating labelling, traceability and user declarations for ai-generated content. It has also sharply cut timelines to take down unlawful content to as little as three hours from 36 hours. The amended rules introduce a statutory definition of "synthetically generated information"

Article Title: Niti Aayog seeks diesel vehicle phase-out, focus on cleaner tech
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Niti Aayog has proposed a roadmap for a net zero pathway for the transport sector which includes phasing out diesel vehicles and focusing on cleaner technologies, as well as tightening Corporate Average Fuel Efficiency (CAFE) norms.“The transition strategy should begin with the phased elimination of polluting diesel vehicles and the adoption of lower-emission technologies such as CNG, hybrids, and electric vehicles ,” said the report, while laying down a long-term pathway to achieve net zero transport emissions by 2070.The report, released Tuesday, said the transition would begin with gradual removal of diesel vehicles and a shift towards cleaner technologies such as CNG, hybrids and electric vehicles. In the next phase, the focus will be on greater use of biofuels through flex-fuel vehicles (FFVs), higher Bio-CNG blending and hybrid FFV models, while electric vehicle adoption continues to rise. The final phase is a full shift to zero-emission vehicles.Niti Aayog said road transport depended heavily on fossil fuels, with petrol and diesel accounting for more than 80% of energy consumption. The think tank warned that India’s ability to cut emissions will also depend on how effectively it enforced CAFE norms.
Article Summary: Niti aayog has proposed a roadmap for a net zero pathway for the transport sector. The report includes phasing out diesel vehicles and focusing on cleaner technologies. It also calls for tightening corporate average fuel efficiency (cafe) norms.

Article Title: US trade deal will bite into Kashmiri apples: J&K CM Omar Abdullah
Article Text:
‘A Pre-Committed Purchase Agreement’: Shashi Tharoor Slams Modi Govt Over India-US Trade Deal

JAMMU: J&K legislators voiced concern on Tuesday over the US trade deal’s potential impact on Kashmiri apples, with many describing it as a “death blow”.“They (Centre) have told America it can send as much fruits and apples as it wants at zero duty and we will buy it here. Where has their sympathy for Jammu and Kashmir gone?” CM Omar Abdullah asked in the assembly.Omar questioned claims by some BJP legislators that the trade deal would benefit the region. “I am still trying to understand where this good thing is for J&K,” Omar said. He claimed apples and walnuts have been placed under zero-duty imports as part of the agreement.CPM legislator MY Tarigami flagged similar worries, claiming the Centre had signed another deal with New Zealand. “These agreements are posing serious challenges to Kashmir’s apple industry, the backbone of our economy,” Tarigami said.PDP MLA Waheed Parra demanded minimum support prices (MSP) for the region’s horticultural produce.
Article Summary: J&k legislators voiced concern on tuesday over the us trade deal’s potential impact on kashmiri apples. “they (centre) have told america it can send as much fruits and apples as it wants at zero duty and we will buy it here. Where has their sympathy for jammu and kashmir gone?” cm omar abdullah asked.

Article Title: Ten days of love: Times Prime's February celebration everyone's talking about
Article Text: February has always been a month of celebration, but this year, it's lasting longer than ever. Times Prime's Love All Members Fest is back for its second edition, running February 6-15, and it's bringing something the season has been missing: ten straight days of joy, surprises, and reasons to celebrate love in every form it takes.Imagine waking up each morning knowing that at noon, something delightful is waiting for you. That's the magic of Love All Members Fest. For ten consecutive days, the Times Prime app unlocks a brand-new exclusive offer—and the anticipation has become a daily ritual for members across India.Last year's fest was a revelation. Members set noon reminders, shared their favorite finds with friends, and made spontaneous plans around the offers. This year, the celebration has grown even bigger — experiences in four cities, and a lineup that truly reflects how beautifully diverse celebration can be.February 6 opens with a golden rose from IGP—perfect whether you send it to someone special or keep it for yourself. February 7 brings Rs 1,000 off travel bookings through Klook. GIVA offers Rs 1,000 off jewelry on February 8, while FlowerAura follows with 25% off on February 9.Members also get 60% off soft toys from FirstCry on February 10, and movie lovers can grab Rs 500 off Cinepolis tickets on February 11.The beauty days arrive next: complimentary full-sized perfume from OG Beauty on February 12, and Renee's Lip Drip Glossy Balm on February 13—both free with just shipping costs. February 14 brings the most indulgent offer: 100% cashback on services at Enrich Beauty. The fest closes on February 15 with Sbooch's Kombucha set, a refreshing wellness-focused note to end the celebration.What makes this year's fest truly special is how it extends beyond your phone screen. Times Prime is bringing members together through the Wine Affair activation—featuring Sangria-making workshops at Café Noir and wine-tasting sessions at Refuge.These aren't just perks; they're experiences worth making time for. There's something uniquely wonderful about learning to craft the perfect Sangria with fellow members or discovering new wine notes in good company.For anyone navigating February solo or simply wanting to meet new people, the Singles Meets happening across Ahmedabad, Mumbai, Kolkata, and Hyderabad offer genuine connection without pressure. Last year's Mumbai gathering filled up in 48 hours, and participants left with friendships that lasted well beyond February.There's a reason Love All Members Fest resonated so deeply in its first year. In a season that can sometimes feel prescriptive about who should celebrate and how, this fest simply opens the doors wider.Couples absolutely celebrate—but so do friends planning group outings, parents treating their kids, colleagues surprising each other, and individuals choosing to invest in themselves. The beauty is in the choice. Every day brings something new, and you take what speaks to you."What I loved most was the lack of pressure," shares Anjali Verma, a Delhi-based member who participated last year. "Some days I claimed offers for myself, some days I surprised my sister. It felt personal, not prescribed."This approach mirrors how Indians naturally celebrate. Just as Diwali festivities stretch across days or Navratri unfolds over nine nights, February becomes a season rather than a single date. There's room to participate when it suits you, in ways that feel meaningful to your life.The fest's growth speaks volumes. From experiences in two cities to four. And membership signups double during fest periods compared to regular months.Last year saw a 67% spike in daily app engagement, with 58% of participants purchasing for themselves or for non-romantic relationships. Social media fills with members sharing their daily finds and coordinating around experiences.Beyond the individual offers, there's something compelling about the cumulative experience. Ten days of checking in. Ten days of pleasant surprises. Ten days of feeling valued.The daily unlock creates a sense of occasion. Noon becomes a moment. Opening the app feels less like a transaction and more like unwrapping a gift chosen just for you. And because each offer is live for just that day, there's genuine excitement to being part of something happening right now.Throughout the fest, members also access "hero deals"—gift hampers, gadgets, wallet offers, and a free two-month Crunchyroll subscription. It's a thoughtfully curated celebration that recognizes how diverse the Times Prime community is.For Times Prime members, participating is simple: open the app at 12 PM daily from February 6-15 and discover what's unlocked. For experiences like wine workshops and Singles Meets, book early—the best moments fill up fast.At its heart, Love All Members Fest is about something beautifully simple: celebrating love without boundaries. Love for partners, parents, friends, yourself. Love expressed through a thoughtful gift, a shared experience, a moment of self-care, or just something that makes you smile.This February, Times Prime is proving that celebration doesn't need to fit a single mold. It can be as diverse, vibrant, and personal as the people doing the celebrating. Ten days. Countless ways to participate. One joyful, inclusive season that reminds us all: everyone deserves to feel celebrated.
Article Summary: Times prime's love all members fest is back for its second edition, running february 6-15. For ten consecutive days, the times prime app unlocks a brand-new exclusive offer. Last year saw a 67% spike in daily app engagement, with 58% of participants purchasing for themselves.

Article Title: Bank holidays in February 2026: When and where will banks remain closed — Check state-wise list
Article Text:
When and where are banks closed in February 2026?

February 18:

February 19:

February 20:

Planning to visit a bank in February? It’s smart to check the holiday schedule first, as an unexpected closure can turn a quick errand into a wasted trip. In India, banks observe both national and state-specific holidays, so closure dates may differ from one region to another. In India, bank holidays include both national and state-specific observances, so closure dates can vary across different regions.Banks will remain closed in Sikkim on account of the Losar festival.Banks will be closed in Maharashtra for Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Jayanti.Banks will not operate in Mizoram and Arunachal Pradesh in observance of State Day/Statehood Day.Apart from these, banks will also remain closed on second and fourth Saturdays of the month, according to RBI.Being aware of bank holidays in advance can help customers plan essential financial transactions and avoid last-minute hassles. While branches may remain closed on these days, it does not prevent customers from carrying out routine transactions. Digital banking services, including online banking, ATMs, mobile apps, and UPI, remain fully operational for fund transfers, bill payments, and other regular activities.However, services that require a physical visit such as large cash deposits, cheque clearances, or issuing demand drafts will not be available. To prevent inconvenience, account holders are encouraged to plan these tasks ahead and make full use of digital banking options during closures.
Article Summary: Banks will be closed in maharashtra for chhatrapati shivaji maharaj jayanti. Services that require a physical visit such as large cash deposits, cheque clearances, or issuing demand drafts will not be available. Digital banking services, including online banking, atms, mobile apps, and upi, remain fully operational.

Article Title: Scent of Ramadan 2026: Gulf's top Arabic cologne trends for women
Article Text:
Ramadan 2026 Fragrance Trends: Arabic Perfumes for Women, Floral-Oriental and Amber Scents

Floral-oriental elegance in Ramadan 2026 for femininity with depth



Warm spices and amber for richness during Ramadan 2026 nights



Ramadan's Scented Secrets: Are Women's Fragrance Choices Becoming Too Bold?

Soft sweetness and powdered accords during Ramadan 2026 for versatility and grace

Layerable and sensory experiences in Ramadan 2026 for personal scent journeys

What Fragrances Will Define Ramadan 2026 for Women? Exploring Arabic Perfume Trends

Why Arabic perfume culture is resonating with women ahead of Ramadan 2026







As the holy month of Ramadan gears up to unfold across the Middle East and beyond, women’s fragrance choices are becoming a meaningful expression of personal style, cultural resonance and sensory storytelling. Arabic perfumes, long celebrated for their rich, evocative compositions, are trending this season not just as gifts or evening scents but as symbolic extensions of the Ramadan experience: warm, comforting and deeply memorable.In 2026, the narrative around women’s fragrances reflects broader industry shifts toward textural sophistication and emotional connection. Global perfumery trends emphasise personalisation, immersive scent experiences and nuanced reinterpretations of classic notes, all of which align beautifully with the rich palette of Arabic perfumery.One of the defining movements in the Ramadan perfume landscape this year is the resurgence of floral-oriental compositions. These perfumes blend soft blossoms like jasmine and rose with deeper bases such as amber and musk, resulting in scents that feel both romantic and sophisticated. For many women, these fragrances strike the perfect balance between everyday elegance and evening allure, suitable for mosque visits, iftar gatherings or Eid celebrations.Floral-oriental profiles are evolving in 2026 to feel more refined and textured. Industry voices note that florals are being paired with unexpected elements of earthier woods, nuanced resins or gourmand undertones, giving traditional blooms a modern and personal expression.As the sun sets and social rhythms begin, many women are drawn toward warm spice and amber compositions. These fragrances open with rich, comforting top notes, often complemented by subtle hints of spice, before settling into amber-clad bases that envelop the wearer in warmth. These profiles are especially beloved for evening wear, when gatherings with loved ones call for something both bold and memorable.In a broader context, amber and spice-driven perfumes resonate with a growing preference for scents that feel like a sensory hug: enveloping, rich and long-lasting. This mirrors global trends where gourmands and amber accords are gaining traction for their comforting, tactile qualities.Another strong current in the Ramadan fragrance story for women is the rise of softly sweet and powdery scents. These are lighter, more approachable compositions featuring gentle sweetness or subtle vanilla-like nuances layered with musky or floral undertones.They are excellent for daytime moments of quiet reflection, casual outings or workplaces where subtlety and elegance are valued over bold projection. This trend toward nuanced sweetness also reflects a shift in the industry where refined gourmand notes feel less dessert-sweet and more textured, mature and wearable.More women are also embracing the idea of scent layering by combining multiple fragrances or formats (like concentrated oils, sprays or body mists) to create something uniquely personal. This approach echoes a broader 2026 trend toward “scent wardrobes” or narrative fragrance experiences, where a perfume isn’t just a single choice but part of a richer sensory identity.Layering allows for playful contrasts like a soft floral with a warm amber base or a light citrus top with a spice-accented dry-down, offering versatility throughout the varied moments of Ramadan and Eid.Arabic perfumes for women this Ramadan are not just trending because of their notes; they are resonating because they bridge tradition and contemporary expression. Their richness and depth reflect cultural heritage, while their evolving compositions align with global fragrance innovations, from gumptious amber blends to nuanced floral artistry.Whether worn for spiritual reflection, family gatherings or festive evenings, these fragrances are helping redefine how scent plays into holiday rituals, turning each application into a small celebration of identity, memory and beauty.
Article Summary: Ramadan 2026 fragrance trends: arabic perfumes for women, floral-oriental and amber scents. Women’s fragrance choices are becoming a meaningful expression of personal style, cultural resonance and sensory storytelling. Arabic perfumes are trending this season not just as gifts or evening scents but as symbolic extensions of the ramadan experience.

Article Title: Mizkif reflects on Maya Higa breakup while discussing JasonTheWeen and Sakura split
Article Text:
Image Via Instagram

Mizkif draws parallels between his breakup and JasonTheWeen–Sakura split

“This is a very similar situation to me and Maya. I was the popular one, she came into my circle, and all of her friends became my friends,”

“This is actually going to make Jason’s career grow. People are going to be more invested in his life and what’s next,”

“The person who’s really going to struggle is Sakura. Where do you go from here when all of your friends are his friends?”





Streamer Mizkif highlighted his past relationship in the course of reacting to the breakup between JasonTheWeen and Sakura. Speaking at a Kick stream, Mizkif related that watching their breakup brought back memories of his breakup with the streamer Maya Higa. His remarks were unique because the personal experience was correlated with a current and widely discussed streamer breakup. Fans immediately drew upon the comparison because all parties involved have online audiences and public personal lives.This, however, happened just a day after JasonTheWeen and Sakura revealed that they had parted ways on February 9, 2026. The two, however, made a joint post where they revealed that they had broken up while still maintaining their respect for each other. The breakup evidently did not come as a surprise, as there had been rumors developing online, including the possibility of Jason cheating on his partner, which he vehemently denied while streaming. The breakup is not the first, either, as the two had parted ways in August 2025 before reuniting.While discussing the situation, Mizkif directly compared it to his own past with Maya Higa.he said.He explained that in streaming relationships, one partner is often more established, which can shape how friendships and careers grow during the relationship.Mizkif also shared his thoughts on how the breakup could affect JasonTheWeen and Sakura differently.he said, suggesting that public attention often increases after major personal events. However, he added that Sakura may face a harder path forward.he asked.His words touched on the common phenomenon where, in the world of streaming, the lines between relationships, work, friendships, and online communities sometimes blend. The experience of having gone through a breakup can find a person starting from scratch or feeling isolated in their social and professional life.Ultimately, however, it was Mizkif's reflections that provided a wider overview on the impact of public break-ups, beyond the emotional toll they can take on an individual. Shared fan bases ensure that, even when a relationship comes to an end, it can have a lingering effect on both parties, and it was with this recognition that JasonTheWeen and Sakura are now moving forward, as illustrated with Mizkif's reflections on this all-too-familiar situation within live stream culture.
Article Summary: Jasontheween and sakura revealed that they had broken up on february 9, 2026. Mizkif compared the situation to his breakup with streamer maya higa. He said that in streaming relationships, one partner is often more established, which can shape how friendships and careers grow.

Article Title: Samsung Galaxy F70e with 6,000 mAh battery, 50MP camera launched in India: Price, specs and more
Article Text:
Samsung Galaxy F70e: Price and availability



Samsung Galaxy F70e specifications



Samsung Galaxy F70e is now official. Samsung has expanded its Galaxy F-series of smartphones with the launch of Galaxy F70e in India. The smartphone features a 50MO main camera and comes with a dedicated Night Mode for brighter and detailed pictures. Samsung Galaxy F70e also features an HD+ display and has a leather pattern finish at the back. The smartphone also comes with IP54 rating which makes water and dust-resistant. The smartphone packs a MediaTek chipset and houses a 6,000 mAh battery.Samsung Galaxy F70e comes in two variants — 4GB+128GB and 6GB+128GB priced at Rs 12,499 and Rs 13,999 respectively. The smartphone will be available online on Flipkart and Samsung.com and offline on authorised retail stores in the country starting February 17. Samsung has also announced limited period bank discount which brings down the price to Rs 11,999.Samsung Galaxy F70e features a 6.7-inch HD+ display with 720x1600 pixel resolution. The display offers up to 800 nits of peak brightness level. The smartphone is powered by an octa-core MediaTek Dimensity 6300 chipset. The smartphone comes in two variants — 4GB+128GB and 6GB+128GB. Users can further expand the storage by adding a microSD card of up to 1TB.The dual SIM Samsung smartphone houses a 50MP main camera with f/1.8 aperture and 2MP depth sensor. Front is home to an 8MP selfie camera with f/2.0 aperture.Samsung Galaxy F70e comes equipped with a side-mounted fingerprint sensor and is backed by a 6,000 mAh battery with 25W fast charging support. The company claims that the battery lasts for up to two days on a single charge.Additionally, its Samsung Knox Vault—which protects users’ financial and personal data from any kind of malware & hardware attack—is Evaluation Assurance Level 5+ (EAL5+) certified. This indicates that its security features have undergone rigorous testing and evaluation, especially for applications in finance, healthcare, and critical infrastructure.
Article Summary: Samsung has expanded its galaxy f-series of smartphones with the launch of galaxy f70e in india. The smartphone features a 50mo main camera and comes with a dedicated night mode for brighter and detailed pictures. It also features an hd+ display and has a leather pattern finish at the back.

Article Title: Apple iPhone 17e reportedly coming soon: A19 chip, MagSafe charging and other features expected
Article Text:
Apple iPhone 17e features (expected)

Apple iPhone 17e price (expected)

Apple is reportedly gearing up to announce the successor to last year’s iPhone 16e. Likely to be called iPhone 17e, the smartphone “is due imminently”, claims Bloomberg’s Mark Gurman in the latest edition of his weekly PowerOn newsletter. “Apple will market the 17e heavily to users in emerging economies and enterprises — two areas the company plans to target aggressively this year with both devices and software,” Gurman writes in the newsletter. He also shared that the phone will come with a few “big changes” that include iPhone 17’s A19 chipset and MagSafe charging, among others.The upcoming iPhone 17e, Gurman says will be powered by the A19 chip that comes with iPhone 17. The A19 offers a modest boost in CPU speed compared to the A18, but most of its improvement is in GPU, thus allowing it to be even better for AI features and gaming.Further, the handset is tipped to get MagSafe charging feature. Another change coming the iPhone 17e is that it may be equipped with Apple’s newest in-house cellular and wireless chips.Korean news outlet The Elec previously reported that the iPhone 17e is expected to feature slimmer display bezels while retaining the iPhone 14-era OLED panel. Other major new features include an 18MP front camera with Center Stage. This camera automatically extends to show everybody in a group selfie, even when you hold the phone vertically.As far as the pricing of the upcoming iPhone 17e is concerned, Gurman says that the company is planning to keep pricing the same as iPhone 16e. To recall, iPhone 16e launched in 2025 with a price tag of $599 or Rs 59,900 in India.
Article Summary: Apple is reportedly gearing up to announce the successor to last year’s iphone 16e. Likely to be called iphone 17e, the smartphone ‘is due imminently’ the phone will come with a few ‘big changes’ that include iphone 17”s a19 chipset and magsafe charging, among others.

Article Title: India AI summit dates, location: Google CEO Sundar Pichai, OpenAI’s Sam Altman, Meta chief AI officer Alexandr Wang, Jensen Huang and other major tech leaders among key attendees
Article Text:
India AI summit dates, location and all things to know

'Biggest AI Summit': Ashwini Vaishnaw Says India AI Impact Summit Getting 'Phenomenal Response'

Who all are attending India AI summit

Indian industrial titans include:

5-star hotels in Delhi fully booked, prices reach Rs 25 lakh for one night

India will soon be the epicenter of the global artificial intelligence (AI) landscape as it is hoting the “India AI Impact Summit 2026” – one of the biggest AI summits in the global south. The event will host a huge gathering of some of the world’s most influential tech leaders. The key attendees include Google CEO Sundar Pichai , Nvidia chief executive Jensen Huang and Meta’s Chief AI Officer Alexandr Wang.The India AI summit is scheduled for February 16–20 in the National Capital, and the event will take place in Bharat Mandapam. On every single day, there will be keynotes, panel discussions and roundtables at Bharat Mandapam/ Sushma Swaraj Bhawan/ Ambedkar Bhawan.The five-day programme will cover policy, research, industry and public engagement, and It will be anchored on 3 foundational pillars, or ‘Sutras’: People, Planet and Progress. The India AI Impact Expo is expected to feature over 300 exhibitors, from 30 countries, across more than 10 thematic pavilions.At this year’s World Economic Forum in Davos, IT minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said that nearly $100 billion in new investments are coming during the upcoming India AI Impact Summit.“Already $70 billion investment is happening and we expect that another $50-$80 billion investment will be coming during the AI Summit. I wouldn't be surprised if we get another $100 billion of investment,” he said. These investments will span across artificial intelligence, semiconductors, infrastructure, and energy, he said.The summit will witness a rare convergence of global “Big Tech” leaders and Indian industrial titans. These include:Sundar Pichai (Google) & Demis Hassabis (Google DeepMind)Jensen Huang (Nvidia)Dario Amodei (Anthropic)Alexandr Wang (Meta)Cristiano Amon (Qualcomm)Nikesh Arora (Palo Alto Networks)Shantannu Narayan (Adobe)Sam Altman (OpenAI) and others.Mukesh Ambani (Reliance Industries)Sunil Bharti Mittal (Bharti Enterprises)K. Krithivasan (TCS)Nandan Nilekani (Infosys)N. Chandrasekaran (Tata Group)According to a report by news agency PTI, five-star hotels in Delhi, including The Taj Palace and The Oberoi, are cashing in on peak demand by offering their luxury suites at a staggering Rs 25 lakh plus taxes for the check-in on February 18 with next day check-out. Standard twin-bed rooms at five-star hotels are also being offered at a steep price for the February 18 check-in, around the peak dates of the India AI Impact Summit 2026 on February 19-20.The Taj Palace is charging a standard rate of Rs 90,000 per night excluding taxes for a luxury suite with king bed pool view, whereas The Oberoi is offering a luxury suite for Rs 3,25,000 per night excluding taxes and fees. For February 18, Taj Palace is offering the Garden Luxury Suite with Private Terrace at Rs 25,00,000 per night.The Luxury Suite at The Leela Palace in New Delhi was available for Rs 17,29,490 per night, excluding taxes and fees, for February 18 check-in, whereas for February 11 check-in, the luxury suite with a balcony is being offered at a much lower rate of Rs 2,94,490 per night, excluding taxes and fees, searches on its website showed.For the February 19 check-in, ITC Maurya's Towers Suite is being offered at a flexible rate of Rs 1,15,000 per night, whereas for the February 11 check-in, it is being offered at Rs 37,000 per night.
Article Summary: 5-star hotels in delhi fully booked, prices reach rs 25 lakh for one night. The india ai summit is scheduled for february 16–20 in the national capital. The key attendees include google ceo sundar pichai and nvidia chief executive jensen huang.

Article Title: “He hated it”: Travis Kelce reportedly felt awkward and forced during outings with Taylor Swift’s former friends Blake Lively and Ryan Reynolds
Article Text:
Travis Kelce reportedly felt awkward and forced during outings with Taylor Swift’s former friend Blake Lively and Ryan Reynolds.(Image via Getty Images, Ryan Reynolds/Instagram)

Travis Kelce reportedly never liked hanging out with Blake Lively and Ryan Reynolds when Taylor Swift was friends with them

Travis Kelce seems to be worried about Taylor Swift

Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce publicly distanced themselves from the pop star’s former best friend, Blake Lively, and her husband, popular Hollywood actor, Ryan Reynolds, ever since their legal drama with Justin Baldoni began.While Taylor Swift could be called to court after her controversial text exchange with Blake Lively was made public, it seems Travis Kelce was never fond of their company.A few hours ago, as per Rob Shuter, a source revealed that, “He hated the double-dating…He felt like it was all optics and no authenticity.”The source added, “Travis is blunt and real…Ryan is curated. That contrast never worked.”Just two months before Taylor Swift was dragged in the legal chaos between Blake Lively and Justin Baldoni, the pop star and Travis Kelce were spotted on a double date with the Hollywood power couple.That was the last time either Taylor Swift or Travis Kelce were spotted alongside Blake Lively and Ryan Reynolds. The two have remained publicly distant from the Hollywood power couple ever since.Around a year ago, there were also strong speculations of Travis Kelce removing Ryan Reynolds from his social media.But neither Travis Kelce nor Ryan Reynolds addressed the speculations in public.While Taylor Swift remains private about her emotions about the situation, it seems Travis Kelce is pretty concerned about her and his future in the league after a pretty poor season on the field.According to The U.S. Sun, a source has said, "Between a difficult season, the reality of preparing for retirement—which has left him stressed and a bit depressed…”The insider added, “And the looming possibility of Taylor being called to court as a witness, it's been emotionally exhausting and increasingly frustrating for him to handle."This has also led to many insiders claiming that Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce have decided to put their “wedding on hold” until they are able to deal with the issues in their lives.However, both Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce have stayed away from confirming these speculations in public.
Article Summary: Travis kelce reportedly felt awkward and forced during outings with taylor swift’s former friend blake lively and ryan reynolds. The two have remained publicly distant from the hollywood power couple ever since. Taylor swift and travis kelce have stayed away from confirming these speculations in public.

Article Title: YouTube Music faces backlash after making song lyrics a premium-only feature
Article Text:
Image Via YouTube

YouTube Music limits free song lyrics to push premium subscriptions





YouTube Music has upset many users after changing how song lyrics work on its app. Earlier, lyrics were free for everyone. Now, free users can only read lyrics for a limited time before they are blocked. This change has prompted dissatisfaction among listeners who love to read song lyrics as they listen. This discontent comes from users’ perception that this move removes a basic feature that assists them in enjoying their favorite music better. The move has also prompted discussion about how much music apps should charge for their features.The update enables free users to view scrollable lyrics for just the first five songs they play. After that limit is reached, the lyrics become blurred and unreadable. To continue seeing lyrics, users must subscribe to YouTube Music Premium, which costs $10.99 per month. The change rolled out widely in early February after being tested with a smaller group of users. A pop-up now appears in the app, showing a countdown of how many free lyric views remain.This move has added to growing criticism of music streaming platforms.While YouTube Music offers free access to songs with ads, many users believe lyrics should remain a basic feature. Lyrics help listeners sing along, learn new languages, and better understand songs. By limiting access, YouTube Music appears to be encouraging users to upgrade to its paid plan rather than improving the free experience.Not all people have the same experience, as some report that they do not usually refer to the lyrics and can get along fine as usual. Some also note that not all songs included in the popular site do have their lyrics available. Despite the various perceptions regarding the change, many regard the change as unnecessary, which according to some, is unfriendly to some of the regular users. This change happens at a time when the service is facing criticism.It is still not clear whether YouTube Music intends to revisit their decision. For now, the limitation on access to lyrics for free users is active. They must weigh their choices between using this service with the limitation and having Premium. Of course, competition between music streaming services can easily depend on their management of basic elements like lyrics.
Article Summary: Youtube music has changed how song lyrics work on its app. Earlier, lyrics were free for everyone. Now, free users can only read lyrics for a limited time before they are blocked. This change has prompted dissatisfaction among listeners who love to read song lyrics as they listen.

Article Title: Rising F1 star Kimi Antonelli survives alarming crash in £180k Mercedes AMG GT
Article Text:
Kimi Antonelli (Image Source: Getty)

Rare Mercedes supercar badly damaged in incident

Pre-season plans for Andrea Kimi Antonelli remain unchanged

Formula 1 prospect Andrea Kimi Antonelli was involved in a scary car accident over the weekend when his high-performance Mercedes AMG GT crashed into a roadside barrier close to his home in San Marino. The 19-year-old, seen as one of modern motorsport's preeminent talents, escaped from the crash unscathed. A team spokesperson confirmed that Antonelli was the only person in the car at the time and that no other cars were involved in the accident.Antonelli was just days away from participating in key pre-season testing alongside the Mercedes Formula 1 squad when the accident occurred. Although the incident is dramatic and the luxury supercar has been heavily damaged, preliminary reports suggest that the young Italian will miss no scheduled track sessions. Antonelli then called the authorities to the scene, who have initiated routine investigations into the cause of the crash.The car in the scene, a Mercedes AMG GT 63 PRO 4MATIC+ Motorsport Collectors Edition, is a not-so-regular model that costs about £180,000. The low production numbers of the limited-production supercar and the fact that it is powered by a twin-turbo V8, among other styling cues from Mercedes' Formula 1 program.It ranks among the best performance cars the brand has on sale today.Images from the scene revealed heavy damage to the car's front end and passenger side from where it hit a guardrail. Fortunately, Antonelli appears to have sustained no injury thanks to the modern safety systems and crashworthiness of the vehicle. Emergency services attended but only as a precaution, and the driver did not need any medical treatment, according to reports. Mercedes then issued a brief statement reassuring the safety and well-being of their young driver.It said authorities were investigating road conditions, nearby vehicles, and speed as part of what caused the crash. The current stage carries no implication of driving dangerously, and is considered an unfortunate accident and not a serious offence.Fortunately for Antonelli's Formula 1 preparations, the accident is not set to hinder his plans. Mercedes is still developing their latest challenger, and it is set to link up with teammate George Russell at official pre-season testing in Bahrain. Sources inside the team have indicated that the 19-year-old is in good shape and that his mind is clear and ready to concentrate on his tasks ahead.Antonelli comes into his first full season as a Mercedes race driver after a swift rise through junior categories. He has always been seen as the potential future star and a part of the team for years to come. The crash added a momentary anxiety that was definitely not needed, but it seems to have had no lasting effects.
Article Summary: Andrea kimi antonelli was involved in a car accident over the weekend. His high-performance mercedes amg gt crashed into a roadside barrier. The 19-year-old escaped from the crash unscathed. He was just days away from participating in key pre-season testing.

Article Title: Delhi needs 36k EV chargers, has just 9k; NCR cities trail badly too
Article Text:
Delhi, NCR stare at EV charging crisis with massive gap in public points

No public EV charging points in GGN, FBD





NEW DELHI: Delhi currently has 8,998 EV charging points against a requirement of 36,177, leaving a shortfall of 27,179, or 302%. Delhi govt has set a target to increase the total number to 16,070 by the end of this year.The situation is similar in neighbouring NCR districts. At present, Gurgaon and Faridabad have no public EV charging points, against requirements of 20 and 26, respectively. Noida has 69 charging points against the required 150 while Greater Noida has only three and needs 13 more.In Ghaziabad, there are 126 public charging points as opposed to the requirement of 450, leading to a gap of 324 points. However, it plans to add 100 such points by Dec 31 this year.According to action plans to deal with air pollution submitted to the Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM), Delhi and NCR cities are targeting adding over 7,300 charging points, mostly in Delhi, by the end of this year.Of the total 8,998 EV charging points in Delhi, 8,849 are under the transport department while the remaining 149 are under Delhi Metro Rail Corporation. As per Delhi's action plan, the authorities will almost double the EV charging points to 16,070 this year, but the gap of over 20,000 will remain.Of the 7,000 points planned in Delhi, most are under the transport department. Six points each will be installed at Anand Vihar and New Ashok Nagar RRTS stations, and 66 at stations of Delhi metro.In terms of battery-swapping infrastructure, Delhi has 948 stations against a requirement of 1,606, with a target to scale this up to 1,268 by the end of 2026.Experts said proper EV infrastructure is key for Delhi's clean mobility, but it should be ensured that timelines are adhered to.According to Anumita Roychowdhury, executive director, research and advocacy, Centre for Science and Environment, "To achieve an ambitious zero-tailpipe-emissions target and improve air quality, the strategy must shift from merely building charging stations to creating a cohesive charging ecosystem. This requires an urgent upscaling of the charging network, dedicated charging hubs and adequate battery-swapping facilities. "Most critical, she said, will be the implementation of ‘Right to Charge' laws to prevent the obstruction of residents installing chargers in their own parking slots. "Mandatorily, a substantial part of all parking spaces in new residential and commercial buildings should be EV-ready," she added.Amit Bhatt, India managing director, International Council on Clean Transportation, said the requirement for EV charging points is based on vehicle density."Apart from the addition of public charging points, destination charging (at home or work) should be considered. Most EV charging points were installed when electrification started, and in space which was easily available. However, additional charging points should be added, considering where the demand is, and such points should be surveilled so that they are not vandalised," said Bhatt.A CAQM official said the commission will monitor and review the progress of the action plans submitted by Delhi and NCR cities, which have set their own individual targets.
Article Summary: Delhi currently has 8,998 ev charging points against a requirement of 36,177. Delhi govt has set a target to increase the total number to 16,070 by the end of this year. At present, gurgaon and faridabad have no publicev charging points.

Article Title: Samsung Galaxy S26 series announced for February 25: What to expect
Article Text: Samsung Galaxy S26 series announced for February 25: What to expect
Article Summary: Samsung galaxy s26 series announced for february 25: what to expect. Samsung galaxy s25 and s26 will go on sale in the u.s. on february 25. Samsung will unveil the new phones at an event in new york on february 26.

Article Title: Saudi schools just did the unthinkable: Video games are now part of education curriculum in KSA
Article Text:
Saudi Arabia Integrates Gaming into School Curricula: A Digital Education Revolution (Representative Image)

What’s happening: Gaming meets education in Saudi schools



Saudi Arabia taps into the global trend of gaming in classrooms



Level Up, Students! Saudi Arabia Adds Electronic Games to School Courses

What the gaming curriculum in Saudi Arabia will cover



Integration of gaming concepts into formal courses using electronic games to illustrate digital literacy, computer science fundamentals, teamwork and creative expression.

National level competitions designed to nurture talent and spotlight student achievements in game design and esports performance.

Professional pathways including training and qualification programs aligned with Saudi scholarship and vocational tracks like Khadem Al-Haramein Scholarship and Wa’ed, supporting future game designers and developers.

What comes next in Saudi Arabia’s gaming curriculum: Implementation and expansion



Saudi Arabia Rewrites School Rules: Electronic Gaming Is Now Officially ‘Educational’ as KSA Taps Into Global Trend





In a bold and unprecedented move, Saudi Arabia ’s Ministry of Education has officially approved the inclusion of electronic gaming, both competitive and educational aspects, in school curricula across all education levels. This landmark initiative aims to bridge traditional education with 21st-century digital skills, creativity and the rapidly growing gaming industry, reflecting a global shift toward recognising video games as valuable tools for learning and future careers.The decision comes after three strategic memorandums of understanding were signed between the Ministry of Education, the National Institute for Educational Development and the Educational Services Development Company with Savvy Games Group, a state-owned gaming enterprise under the Public Investment Fund. These agreements formalise the integration of electronic games into curricula, development of national gaming competitions and training pathways to build local talent within the gaming sector.Coverage from Al-Marsad newspaper reports that the collaboration will include working with the National Curriculum Center to embed game-related skills and knowledge in school content, alongside initiatives to upskill educators, create educational games and support nationwide innovation challenges tied to the gaming industry.This is one of the most significant educational policy shifts in the Middle East in recent years, not just because games are fun but because they can teach transferable and future-oriented skills. According to international research and global education commentary, competitive video gaming and esports programs in schools can nurture collaboration, strategic thinking, problem-solving, communication and leadership, all skills employers increasingly value.For example, schools in Wales and the US that implemented esports suites and gaming programs noted positive impacts on student engagement, teamwork and pathways into tech-related careers. Just as structured arts or sports programs can support growth, gaming education, when well designed, can be both academic and practical.Saudi Arabia’s move aligns with global experimentation around gaming as an educational tool. In Japan, certain schools have incorporated video games into classroom learning to help students build critical thinking and communication skills, with high participation and positive university progression rates among graduates.Likewise, academic discussion including research into game-based learning curricula such as Quest To Learn in the US, has highlighted how games can reinforce systems thinking and engagement, supporting traditional subjects like math, science and language through interactive design and strategic challenges. Saudi officials are positioning the gaming curriculum initiative as part of a larger push toward digital transformation, innovation and job creation in future industries.The Kingdom’s gaming sector already demonstrates strength, with millions of players and billions in annual revenue, signalling robust interest and economic potential. By formalising gaming education, authorities aim to prepare students for careers across game development, design, esports management, digital media, cybersecurity and related tech sectors. These are the fields that are poised for growth alongside Saudi Arabia’s broader economic diversification goals.While official details on the exact curriculum framework are still emerging, the memorandums outline several key components:The initiative is also expected to include the establishment of gaming labs and innovation hubs within technical and vocational institutions, geared toward hands-on experience and industry projects. Global education voices, including contributors to research platforms and the World Economic Forum , have explored how esports and gaming curricula can teach teamwork, leadership, problem solving and communication skills, especially when embedded within supportive academic structures.These programs often serve dual purposes: they enhance student engagement (particularly among learners who struggle with traditional teaching methods) and they create career pathways in technology, digital arts, programming and business.Saudi Arabia’s Ministry of Education is now in the roll-out phase, working with curriculum developers, industry partners and training institutions to finalise content, teacher preparation and infrastructure. The early emphasis will likely be on pilot programs, teacher upskilling and integration phases to ensure the curriculum complements, rather than replaces, existing subject goals.Over time, the success of this gaming integration could attract attention from other countries in the region exploring innovative education models that respond to a rapidly evolving labour market and the rise of digital economies globally. With the official inclusion of electronic gaming in Saudi school curricula, the Kingdom is at the forefront of a global shift toward embracing games as tools for learning, creativity and future career readiness.While challenges remain, including ensuring balanced screen time and aligning gaming with core academic standards, the initiative signals a bold rethinking of how education can evolve to reflect the digital aspirations of a new generation of learners.
Article Summary: Saudi arabia integrates gaming into school curricula: a digital education revolution. Three memorandums of understanding were signed between the ministry of education, the national institute for educational development and the educational services development company with savvy games group.

Article Title: TenZ responds after viral posts accuse Kyedae of cheating clarifies John Choi trip and calls rumors harmful
Article Text:
TenZ responds after viral posts accuse Kyedae of cheating clarifies John Choi trip and calls rumors harmful (Image via Getty)



Tyson “TenZ” Ngo shuts down cheating claims involving Kyedae Shymko and John Choi





Tyson “TenZ” Ngo spoke up after online rumors began spreading about his past relationship with streamer Kyedae Shymko. The talk started on social media and quickly picked up attention. Some posts claimed Kyedae cheated on him with voice actor John Choi. TenZ did not stay quiet. On February 9, 2026, he replied directly on X after a viral post shared screenshots from a Reddit page discussing the rumors. His message was clear and direct. He said the story being shared online was not true and had gone too far.He explained that John Choi is a close friend to both him and Kyedae. According to TenZ, people online were taking photos out of context and using them to push a story that does not exist. He also addressed another false claim, saying he never donated bone marrow to Kyedae. Later the same day, TenZ shared another post explaining how years in esports helped him handle online hate. As of now, Kyedae has not shared any public statement about the situation.In his first response, Tyson Ngo made it clear that the rumors upset him. He said people were spreading made-up stories and pushing anger online without knowing the truth.TenZ wrote that John Choi is a friend to both him and Kyedae Shymko. He explained that the trip being discussed was one he was meant to attend but had to cancel at the last minute. He also said another close friend was present, but that person was cut out of shared photos to change the story.TenZ said people should stop guessing about relationships they are not part of. He added that pushing hate online often comes from personal insecurity, not facts.He then cleared up a second rumor. TenZ said he never donated bone marrow to Kyedae and does not know how that story even started. He questioned whether people were sharing these claims just to upset others and gain attention online.Later that day, TenZ posted again, saying competitive gaming helped him build thick skin. He wrote that years in esports made him less affected by internet hate. He also joked that people interacting with his post were helping him earn platform revenue. As of now, Kyedae has not responded publicly. The statements from TenZ remain the only direct clarification on the situation.
Article Summary: Tenz responds after viral posts accuse kyedae of cheating clarifies john choi trip and calls rumors harmful. Tenz said people were spreading made-up stories and pushing anger online without knowing the truth. Later that day, tenz posted again, saying competitive gaming helped him build thick skin.

Article Title: Twitch introduces new ads for paused streams, sparks viewer backlash
Article Text:
Image Via Twitch

“pause-screen ads.”

Twitch’s new pause-screen ads draw criticism from viewers and streamers





Twitch is introducing a new kind of advertisement that will appear when the stream is paused. Advertising was one of the main ways for streamers to earn money on Twitch, though it sometimes resulted in a loss for the viewers who missed important parts of the stream. Viewers who want to avoid these interruptions can sign up for Twitch Prime or Turbo; however, not all may afford these services. There have already been complaints over the new kind of advertisement from both the viewers and the streamers themselves who claim that this may adversely affect the streaming service.The new ads will show up whenever someone pauses a stream, even if they step away from the screen. Twitch announced this update on February 10, 2026, saying it is part of an experiment calledThe company also noted that skippable ads are still being tested at the same time. While the goal is to make ads less intrusive, many users have expressed frustration, saying ads while paused could cause viewers to fall behind the live stream or disrupt their viewing habits.Many people have expressed their concerns about the new change through various social media posts. There was even criticism that people may become irritated since pausing a video might be used for quick look-up of information, and the ads might interfere with the pause.Hence, people may stop using the site. The prominent Twitch streamers have also expressed their own concerns that the new ads may interfere with the viewing experience and be detrimental to the streamers.Although there is a backlash, the platform asserts that the test is intended to generate additional earnings for the streamer without totally disrupting the stream. It is said that the ads will only be shown while the stream is paused, thus the streaming will still be conducted at the back of the screen.Ultimately, the new ads that will appear while the viewer has their Twitch video paused serve as a prime example of the constantly ongoing issue of finding the right balance in the name of generating more income without making the user experience suffer as a result. While the streamer derives the intended benefits from such a feature, the viewer base nonetheless has legitimate issues with the overall experience.
Article Summary: The new ads will show up whenever someone pauses a stream, even if they step away from the screen. Twitch announced this update on february 10, 2026, saying it is part of an experiment called skippable ads. While the goal is to make ads less intrusive, many users have expressed frustration, saying ads while paused could cause viewers to fall behind.

Article Title: Best skills to learn for GCC jobs in 2026: What employers are really hiring for in the Gulf, from AI to cloud, cybersecurity and more
Article Text:
Top 2026 Skills for GCC Job Market: AI, Data, Cybersecurity and More

Artificial intelligence and machine learning skills



Data analytics and data science



What Skills Will Land You a Job in the GCC in 2026? The Future of Work Revealed

Cybersecurity skills



This includes roles such as:



Cyber risk analysts

Information security managers

Cloud security specialists

Cloud computing and digital infrastructure



Engineering and project management skills



Sustainability and green skills



GCC's Digital Gold Rush: Are You Skilled Enough for 2026's Tech Takeover?

Soft skills: Leadership, communication and adaptability



Lifelong learning and reskilling mindset



Understanding localisation policies







As GCC economies accelerate towards digital-first, knowledge-driven growth, the skills that employers are looking for in 2026 have shifted dramatically. From Saudi Arabia ’s Vision 2030 projects to the UAE’s AI-led governance push, hiring priorities across the Gulf are increasingly shaped by technology adoption, sustainability goals and workforce localisation policies.Artificial Intelligence sits at the heart of GCC transformation strategies. According to the Hays GCC Salary Guide 2026 , digital and AI-driven roles are among the hardest to fill across the Middle East , with 90% of employers reporting skills shortages, particularly in advanced tech roles.Academic research supports this shift. A 2024 study published on arXiv , analysing millions of job listings, found that AI adoption increases demand not just for AI engineers but for AI-literate professionals across non-technical roles as well. The paper noted, “AI exposure is associated with higher demand for complementary skills such as analytical thinking, adaptability and collaboration.”In the GCC, AI skills are increasingly required in finance, healthcare, government services, logistics and media, not just tech firms.Data has become the backbone of decision-making in Gulf organisations. A landmark 2017 Strategy and PwC report on the GCC digital workforce found that while digital adoption is growing, advanced data skills remain scarce, limiting productivity gains.The report stated, “The shortage of advanced analytics and data science skills is one of the biggest barriers preventing GCC organisations from capturing full value from digital investments.” As governments and enterprises push for smart cities, fintech ecosystems and AI-powered public services, professionals skilled in data analysis, business intelligence and statistical modelling are becoming indispensable.With rapid digitisation comes increased cyber risk. While GCC-specific academic studies are limited, global labour research consistently ranks cybersecurity among the fastest-growing skills worldwide, a trend echoed in GCC hiring data.According to hiring outlooks cited by Khaleej Times and regional recruitment firms, cybersecurity specialists remain in high demand as governments and private firms strengthen digital infrastructureThese skills are especially relevant in banking, government, aviation and healthcare sectors across the GCC.Cloud expertise is now a foundational requirement rather than a niche skill. As per global hiring outlook reports AI, cloud and platform engineering roles dominate new job creation in global capability centres expanding operations linked to GCC markets.Cloud architects, DevOps engineers and platform specialists are especially valuable as Gulf companies migrate operations to scalable digital ecosystems.Despite the digital pivot, engineering and project management remain pillars of GCC employment, driven by infrastructure, energy and urban development megaprojects. According to regional hiring analyses cited by Khaleej Times, demand continues for professionals who can manage large-scale, multi-stakeholder projects, particularly those integrating digital and sustainability elementsProject managers with technical literacy, risk management skills and cross-cultural leadership ability are especially prized.Sustainability is no longer optional in the GCC. With the UAE and Saudi Arabia investing heavily in renewable energy, clean technology and climate initiatives, green skills are moving into the mainstream.A recent 2025 workforce analysis by PeopleConnect Global highlights rising demand for professionals skilled in sustainability reporting, renewable energy systems and environmental compliance across GCC markets.Roles linked to net-zero strategies, ESG compliance and sustainable infrastructure are expected to grow steadily through 2026.Multiple studies stress that human skills grow more valuable as automation increases. The same arXiv 2024 study on AI and labour markets found that AI-exposed roles show higher demand for teamwork, communication and resilience, not less.In the GCC, where teams are highly multicultural, employers increasingly value professionals who can lead diverse teams, communicate clearly and adapt to fast-changing environments.The 2027 Strategy& GCC digital workforce report emphasises that long-term employability depends not on one-time qualifications but on continuous upskilling. The report noted that economies that embed lifelong learning frameworks will be better positioned to meet future labour demands.This message is echoed in national workforce strategies across the Gulf.Understanding Emiratisation, Saudisation and national talent development policies is increasingly important. The Hays GCC Salary Guide 2026 highlights that localisation efforts are reshaping hiring strategies, particularly in leadership and specialist roles. Professionals who align their skills with these frameworks gain a competitive edge.Research across academia, recruitment and policy consistently point to one conclusion that GCC jobs in 2026 will reward hybrid professionals or those who combine digital fluency, analytical capability, adaptability and human-centric skills. From AI literacy to sustainability expertise, the most future-proof careers will belong to individuals who learn continuously, adapt quickly and align with the region’s transformation goals.
Article Summary: Top 2026 skills for gcc job market: ai, data, cybersecurity and more. Hiring priorities across the gulf are increasingly shaped by technology adoption, sustainability goals and workforce localisation policies. According to the hays gcc salary guide 2026, digital and ai-driven roles are among the hardest to fill.
